news.title: Justice Department Proposes Major Overhaul of Sec. 230 Protections
news.description: DOJ officials recently recommended sweeping changes to Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act of 1996, but only Congress has the authority to amend the law.

news.title: Google Will Start Paying Some Publishers for News Articles
news.description: As part of a new licensing program, Google will begin paying for content from certain publishers starting in Australia, Germany, and Brazil, with more locations to follow soon.

news.title: Detroit Police Admit to First Facial Recognition Mistake After False Arrest
news.description: The ACLU has filed a complaint against the Detroit Police Department on behalf of a Black Michigan resident they allege was falsely arrested because of facial recognition software.
